# pss.model.comparison

The goal of pss.model.comparison is to …

## Installation

You can install the development version of pss.model.comparison from
[GitHub](https://github.com/) with:

``` r
# install.packages("pak")
pak::pak("sempwn/pss-model-comparison")
```

## Example

This is a basic example which shows you how to solve a common problem:

``` r
library(pss.model.comparison)
## basic example code
```

What is special about using `README.Rmd` instead of just `README.md`?
You can include R chunks like so:

``` r
summary(cars)
#>      speed           dist       
#>  Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00  
#>  1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00  
#>  Median :15.0   Median : 36.00  
#>  Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98  
#>  3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00  
#>  Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00
```

You’ll still need to render `README.Rmd` regularly, to keep `README.md`
up-to-date. `devtools::build_readme()` is handy for this.

You can also embed plots, for example:

![](reference/figures/README-pressure-1.png)

In that case, don’t forget to commit and push the resulting figure
files, so they display on GitHub and CRAN.

# Package index

## All functions

- [`add_averted_columns()`](https://sempwn.github.io/pss-model-comparison/reference/add_averted_columns.md)
  : calculate deaths and overdoses averted
- [`calculate_year_quarter_data()`](https://sempwn.github.io/pss-model-comparison/reference/calculate_year_quarter_data.md)
  : Summarize Model Data by Year-Quarter
- [`create_odd_labels()`](https://sempwn.github.io/pss-model-comparison/reference/create_odd_labels.md)
  : Create labels for odd-indexed elements
- [`get_low_medium_high_breaks()`](https://sempwn.github.io/pss-model-comparison/reference/get_low_medium_high_breaks.md)
  : get result breaks into small, medium, and large categories
- [`get_max_min_breaks()`](https://sempwn.github.io/pss-model-comparison/reference/get_max_min_breaks.md)
  : get max and min deaths_averted from results
- [`load_data()`](https://sempwn.github.io/pss-model-comparison/reference/load_data.md)
  : Load and Combine BCROM and OTEM Model Output Data
- [`load_sensitivity_analysis_data()`](https://sempwn.github.io/pss-model-comparison/reference/load_sensitivity_analysis_data.md)
  : Load and combine sensitivity analysis data from OTEM and BCROM
  models
- [`plot_deaths_averted_lines()`](https://sempwn.github.io/pss-model-comparison/reference/plot_deaths_averted_lines.md)
  : Plot cumulative deaths averted across models and runs
- [`plot_model_difference_heatmap()`](https://sempwn.github.io/pss-model-comparison/reference/plot_model_difference_heatmap.md)
  : Plot Model Difference Heatmap
- [`plot_outcome_by_quarter()`](https://sempwn.github.io/pss-model-comparison/reference/plot_outcome_by_quarter.md)
  : Plot Outcome by Year-Quarter and Model
- [`plot_sensitivity_analysis_heatmap()`](https://sempwn.github.io/pss-model-comparison/reference/plot_sensitivity_analysis_heatmap.md)
  : Plot sensitivity analysis heatmaps
- [`process_twsa_data()`](https://sempwn.github.io/pss-model-comparison/reference/process_twsa_data.md)
  : Process data for sensitivity analysis plotting
- [`summarise_events_averted()`](https://sempwn.github.io/pss-model-comparison/reference/summarise_events_averted.md)
  : summarise deaths averted
- [`summarise_year_quarter_data()`](https://sempwn.github.io/pss-model-comparison/reference/summarise_year_quarter_data.md)
  : Summarize model outputs by year and quarter
- [`twsa_heatmap_plot()`](https://sempwn.github.io/pss-model-comparison/reference/twsa_heatmap_plot.md)
  : Create a Sensitivity Analysis heatmap plot
